summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events leading up to and following the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, his discovery unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, the medical response, official notifications, and subsequent investigative actions by the FBI and OIG.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death by suicide is the central subject of the timeline. He was visited by attorneys on August 9 and was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10.

persons.name: Reyes Efrain
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The warden of the institution who arrived at 7:30 am on August 10, notified the PIO and OIG of the incident.

persons.name: SIS Lt
persons.context: A prison official notified of the incident, arrived at the institution, and reported to the SHU to conduct interviews.

persons.name: CMC
persons.context: A prison staff member notified of the incident, traveled to the hospital to secure Epstein's belongings, and notified Epstein's next of kin.

persons.name: IDO
persons.context: A prison staff member who provided Epstein a social call on August 9 and later traveled to the hospital with the CMC.

persons.name: Acting Chief Psychologist
persons.context: A prison staff member notified of the incident and who arrived at the institution later on August 10.

persons.name: PIO
persons.context: A prison staff member notified of the incident by the Warden and who handled the press release.

persons.name: Computer Services Manager
persons.context: An individual who arrived late on August 10 to remove and replace computer hard drives from the SHU.

persons.name: OIG Agent
persons.role: Office of the Inspector General Agent
persons.context: An investigator notified of the incident, who arrived at the institution, visited the SHU, and later departed with computer equipment.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: The doctor at Beekman Hospital who reported the official time of Epstein's death.

connections.description: Reyes Efrain is identified as Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.
The Case Management Coordinator was responsible for notifying Epstein's next of kin and securing his property after death.
The Inmate Disciplinary Officer provided Epstein a social call the night before his death and reported he was in good spirits.
OIG and FBI agents coordinated at the institution, jointly visited the SHU, and departed together to investigate the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day of Attorney Visits
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein spent the day in attorney conferences and was provided a social call by an IDO in the evening, who reported he was in good spirits.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm was activated in the SHU. Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell and initiated CPR.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and EMS performed CPR, applied an AED, intubated Epstein, and administered epinephrine before transporting him to Beekman Hospital.

events.title: Official Time of Death
events.description: At 7:36 am, an ER physician at Beekman Hospital reported the official time of Epstein's death.

events.title: Official Notifications
events.description: A cascade of notifications was made following the death, including to the USMS, Warden, PIO, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and Epstein's next of kin (brother).

events.title: Investigation Initiation
events.description: The FBI and OIG were notified and arrived at the MCC to investigate the incident. SIS Lt. began interviewing inmates on the tier.

events.title: SHU Computer Hard Drive Removal
events.description: Late in the evening, a Computer Services Manager arrived to remove hard drives from computers in the SHU and replace them with new ones.

events.title: OIG Secures Computer Equipment
events.description: An OIG Agent departed the institution with two specific computer units (FPS 021407270 and FPS 0214207268).

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
The night before his death (August 9), an Inmate Disciplinary Officer (IDO) reported Epstein was 'in good spirits' during a social call.
Epstein's official time of death was reported by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on August 10.
Computer hard drives were removed from the SHU and replaced with new ones late on the night of Epstein's death, and specific computers were later taken by the OIG.
Multiple agencies were swiftly involved in the investigation, including the prison's SIS, the FBI, and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
